revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Motorola |model=SURFboard SVG7782U |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/11/2013 |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=cable modem, wireless router, analog phone gateway |fcc_id=W5HSVG7782HH |ic_id=5117A-SVG7782HH |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=C7 |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac=true |pwr_ac_hz=50-60 |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (oversized), USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=DOCSIS 3.0, MoCA 1.1, battery |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=Motorola |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''SVG7782 Wireless Voice Cable Modem Gateway''
Note: '''Arris''' is the new (and current) owner of '''Motorola Home''', '''[[wikipedia:Motorola Mobility|Motorola Mobility]]''''s (previously '''Motorola''''s cell phone [''mostly''] division, now a subsidiary of '''Google''') broadband unit. See more info on [http://techcrunch.com/2012/12/19/motorola-home-finds-a-new-home-at-arris-google-sells-broadband-unit-for-2-35b-to-double-down-on-mobile/ '''TechCrunch'''] and elsewhere...
The P/N of this device looks to be 589529-004-00.
The FCC ID covering this entry also covers the diagnostic-use model (''SVG7782U DIAGNOSTIC'', P/N: 589529-002-00) and the USB-less model (''SVG7782'', P/N: 589529-001-00).
Per the FCC photos... *The '''MoCA''' controller is from '''Entropic Communications'''. *The '''Motorola''' logo, "5G WIFI CARD", and "588432-002 REV.4" is silkscreened on the 5GHz WiFi module. **The 5GHz module has two integral on-card antennas and a U.FL jack for another with different positioning (marked '''BLUE'''). It looks to be using three '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') PAMs. *(("2.4G WIFI CARD", "588432-001 REV.3", the '''Motorola''' logo, and "PCB MADE IN CHINA" on the back of one) OR ("2.4G WIFI CARD", "588434-001 REV.4", and the '''Motorola''' logo))is silkscreened on the 2.4GHz WiFi module. **The 2.4GHz module has one integral on-card antenna and two U.FL jacks for two antennas mounted in a different position. They are marked as '''YELLOW''' and '''WHITE''' on one board shown. *The power supply module is a '''Delta Electronics, Inc.''' ADP-48AN AA / '''Motorola''' P/N 588239-001 (100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 2A -> 12VDC, 4.17A, COO: China). *The battery is '''Motorola''' branded (7.4V, Li-ion). The P/N is 586185-001-00. Cell origin is Japan, final assembly was done in China *Silkscreened text on the antennas... **"single 2.4GHz antenna - MOTOROLA MOBILITY LLC", "589245-001 REV 2", and "05-SEP-2012" **combo antenna - "MOTOROLA MOBILITY LLC", "589248-002 REV 1", and "06-SEP-2012"
